meanings.definition: Capable of being resolved or solved.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle was resoluble with a little help.
meanings.sent2: The math problem was resoluble after studying the formula.
meanings.sent3: The mystery was resoluble once the detective found the missing clue.
meanings.sent4: The conflict between the two friends was resoluble through open communication.
meanings.sent5: The resoluble nature of the problem made it easier to tackle.

meanings.definition: Able to be dissolved or broken down.
meanings.sent1: The sugar was resoluble in hot water.
meanings.sent2: The medication was resoluble in liquid form.
meanings.sent3: The candy was resoluble in the mouth, creating a sweet sensation.
meanings.sent4: The ice was resoluble under the warm sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The resoluble nature of the substance allowed for easy cleaning.

meanings.definition: Able to be settled or determined.
meanings.sent1: The dispute was resoluble through a fair compromise.
meanings.sent2: The issue was resoluble once all parties reached an agreement.
meanings.sent3: The resoluble decision brought peace to the community.
meanings.sent4: The resoluble outcome of the trial satisfied both sides.
meanings.sent5: The resoluble nature of the problem led to a swift resolution.
